data.title: Sports wire
data.meta_description: Nebraska's much-anticipated alternate uniform, complete with a black helmet, was unveiled yesterday.
data.text:
NBA

Kirilenko signs with Timberwolves after trade creates cap space

The Minnesota Timberwolves signed versatile free-agent forward Andrei Kirilenko, bringing him back to the NBA after a one-season absence.

The contract was completed as soon as Minnesota consummated a three-team trade with New Orleans and Phoenix to clear space under the salary cap for Kirilenko.

Kirilenko, 31, is playing with the Russian team at the Olympics. He played 10 years for the Utah Jazz, averaging 12.4 points and 5.6 rebounds, but spent the 2011-12 season with the CKSA Moscow club. He won the Most Valuable Player and Best Defender awards in the Euroleague.

• New Orleans Hornets first-round draft pick Austin Rivers had surgery to clean up bone spurs in his right ankle but is expected to be ready for the start of training camp.

Rivers, a guard from, Duke was taken 10th overall.

• Veteran big man Ronny Turiaf signed a one-year contract with the Los Angeles Clippers.

• The Chicago Bulls signed free-agent center Nazr Mohammed.

Elsewhere

New Stanford athletic director will try to continue school’s success

Stanford hired Delaware’s Bernard Muir as its athletic director.

He replaces Bob Bowlsby, who left last month after six years to become the Big 12’s commissioner.

Muir will take over a Stanford program that has won the Directors’ Cup 18 straight years and is enjoying a football renaissance. The award is given annually by the National Association of Collegiate Directors of Athletics to the program with the most success in all sports.

• The Winnipeg Jets signed defenseman Toby Enstrom to a five-year, undisclosed contract extension.

— From wire reports
